text: Gordon Alexander (1885 - 24 April 1917) was a British fencer. He competed in the individual foil and épée events at the 1912 Summer Olympics. He was killed in action during World War I. ==Death== While attacking the town of Villers- Plouich, a fellow soldier was wounded by a German artillery shell, and Alexander rushed to help him. While Alexander was dressing the soldier's wound, he was killed by another shell. ==See also== * List of Olympians killed in World War I ==References== Category:1885 births Category:1917 deaths Category:British military personnel killed in World War I Category:British male fencers Category:Olympic fencers of Great Britain Category:Fencers at the 1912 Summer Olympics Category:People from Kensington Category:Sportspeople from London
title: Gordon Alexander
